summary: SummaryThe CHI Round 3-In-1 Blowout Brush Dryer creates professional blowout quality results with exceptional volume. Includes three attachments for unlimited styling options. Whether you're looking for a straight, wavy or curly look, CHI your way!
details: DetailsBenefitsBuilt in ion generator emits negative ions to reduce frizz and increase shineCeramic technology locks in moisture and maintains shineThe nylon and tufted bristles create tension at the root of the hair giving hair full body with just one passFeatures3 interchangeable attachments for unlimited styling options - 1" Round Brush, 1.7" Round Brush, Oval Paddle BrushCompact and lightweight design7 ft. swivel and tangle free cordItem 2600637

reviews.headline: Not Good
reviews.comments: I bought this dryer with high hopes of it drying my hair and leaving it smooth and shiny.  Not happening! The dryer itself is good, light weight, temperatures not too hot and handles well.  But, it left my hair SO frizzy. My hair is somewhat wavy, not very thick and normally easy to dry.  But the bristles on the brush are both nylon and hard plastic.  I believe this is why it made my hair so frizzy.  The bristles pulled the hair more than a normal nylon bristle brush would have.  I tried it a couple of times just to make sure and results were the same both times. So I would have to give the dryer a thumbs down.  Sorry.

reviews.headline: Damaging
reviews.comments: I really loved this brush. It was easy for me to use and I liked the shape and medium size of the brush part. I have long hair and it's very smoothing, but I realized that it really damages my hair. My hair is nice after styling but the next time I wash it my hair feels so gummy and dry. The first time this happened I thought I didn't wash my hair well enough, as if there was alot of build up in my hair shaft. But it kept happening after I used this brush. I also used it on 80% dry hair.

reviews.headline: It's fine…for the price
reviews.comments: I got this because, lets be honest, the dyson and the shark are SO EXPENSIVE and we are all just trying to find other options. The revlon is allegedly too hot for your hair and this is a "better option." It's really not. It does nothing for my hair except make it frizzy. Its really not the best for a full blow out. I'm sad because it still was a pretty penny. But it mostly sits in my bathroom and once in a while I will use it. Would not reccomend.

faceoff_positive.comments:
Tbh, I just purchased this product and had low expectations. I don't particularly like Chi products. 
I have very curly/ corkscrew/ coily, somewhat fine hair but a lot of it and blowing drying it takes time and can be a hassle. That being said this blow drying brush was better than expected. Overall, my results were good and took about 30 mins in total to do my whole head which is an improvement from the 1 hr it takes with manual brush/ blowdryer duo. It left my hair very soft and initially was very smooth with minimal frizz and sleek at the root. 
I would recommend using while hair is about 60- 80% dry and working in smaller sections. The larger and less detangled my sections were as I got "lazier", the frizzier my ends would be. The attachments are easy to change and I like that the on- off -cool- low- high switch requires two hands as to not accidentally change the settings mid-use.

I read reviews about the attachments not staying and that the product gets too hot or not hot enough.

1. This is my first time using but the attachments stayed well even when I accidentally pressed the button so my advice would be make sure you're matching the arrows and securing them correctly.
2. The attachments do get hot but not right away, as you start to use the brush more throughout the style they will heat up but nothing more surprising than using a hot tool on high so keep that in mind. I think the heat is nothing more than a normal blow dryer being used on high setting.

I cant speak on the product malfunctioning after a few uses and not turning on but I have high hopes and will do research into warranty plans
faceoff_positive.headline: Nice

faceoff_negative.comments: Chi loses 2 stars because of poor design which makes using this otherwise really nice tool a hassle. This tool works really well. Dries my hair super fast and leaves it bouncy and shiny. As other reviewers have stated, the handle is huge at the bottom and impossible to hold there. I can see why, I suppose the motor has to go somewhere. But that makes your hand naturally move up the handle closer to the brush. That's where the problem is. There are two quick release buttons so you can swap out the different brushes. I cannot tell you how many times I've accidentally pressed a button and popped the brush off mid-use. Very annoying. The top of the tool is also very small so it's tough to hold onto to stabilize the tool as you are turning it. Also, it requires two hands to turn on/off or change the speed. Chi people, come on. A one-handed mechanism is better for changing speed, which you may want to do periodically as you are using it. Conversely, NO ONE needs a one handed button to swap out the heads. We'd never do this mid-use. Overall I like this tool and the price was good, but I likely will replace it with something else when the time comes and not get another one of these. Gonna give a "not recommend" for this one because you should've done better, Chi.
faceoff_negative.headline: I'd have given it 5 stars if not for the poor design
